reviewText:
Well.. what can I say.
Not too bad for a B shooter. Very linear though, get pushed down the 'tunnel' but the older havok effects are still nice. Basically get 3 weapons throughout the game. Assault Rifle, Sniper Rifle and RPG. Just point and shoot with no fancy bullet drop and such of course. Controls are a bit backwards but remapable (press e to use ironsight) Voice acting is acceptable.
Now to the main problem. The length.. This game lasted all of about 40minutes on hard. I'm really quite shocked. :)

Would I recommend it? Not really, no. Only for the collectors.

reviewText:
It's been a while since I've played a game this bad. Visually it's a mixed bag... as I thought the weapon models were okay and some of the texture work passable... but the character models are simply bad. The level design is bland, the interaction near non existent. The voice over is HORRENDOUS! The music is equally just garbage. The A.I doesn't even look at you while shooting, cant' figure out how to move around a car and is more or less cannon fodder for the very short time that this game lasts.

Which won't be long... and if you ran through it, it'd last even less. The cut scenes are badly drawn 2D images accompanied by the horrible voice acting and a story that more or less has a group of militia make their way through a city after being attacked by aliens. The aiming... works... but it doesn't matter as the game is brain dead. The controls are limited and in my case, for some reason, even though I was playing with a keyboard/mouse it would send rumble feedback to my connected 360 controller... without any option to turn that off.

It's lazy, poorly done, lacks any kind of polish and just serves to remind me that not every game is worth playing.

reviewText:
I picked this game up while it was on sale because I liked the movie.
It bears a number of similarities to the movie, the characters are the same, and you're gaming out the movie.

In game its decent, the models and textures are reasonable for the $5 I put into it, and the aliens look good too, however that's where the positive parts end.
The negatives begin before you even start the game.
Everyone reading this has played a shooter, WSAD, R(reload), E(use), right click(zoom/sights), standard keys, or so you would think, this would be the case.
No, instead E is to zoom/sight, and X is use, R is thankfully still reload.
Next is the cutscenes, again, you might think that with decent graphics in game while playing the cutscenes would be decent, but no, they (and there's enough of them) look like they were drawn by a 5 year old and animated by the south park guys.
Then there's the magic aliens, who can also shoot through walls, who can see me before I get there (I actually had one firing before I rounded a corner), and have hitboxes smaller than the model.
If you push too hard too fast, the game's solution is to kill you instantly, so, don't try to flank the aliens too much.

On normal mode, with a number of deaths before I figured out the insta-death, I beat the game in the 1.3h that steam tells me, that was enough and it's going away.

If you can get this game for a buck or two, and if you liked the movie, give it a try, if you're looking for a good shooter with a decent story, don't bother.

Oh, and you multi-player fans, yeah, not so much.
